p.div: Can I use Carrot2 in a commercial project?
Yes. The only requirement is that you properly acknowledge the use of Carrot2 and let us know about your project. Please also remember to read the license.
I'd like to add Carrot2 clustering to my existing search engine. Where do I start?

You need to create an input component that gets search results from your engine and feeds them to Carrot2. Please see the documentation, API reference and source code of exising input components for useful hints. Then, you can reuse some bits of the Carrot2 web application (located in the carrot2/ applications/ carrot2-demo-webapp folder of the source repository) to visualize the clusters. If you need more help, please let us know.

No. Carrot2 can add clustering of search results to an existing search engine. You can use an Open Source project called Nutch to crawl your website. Nutch has a Carrot2-based search clustering plugin, so you'll get all crawling, searching and clustering in one piece. If you need any help with any of these, please contact us.
